channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3547] Girlfriend found wierd vids I made of her... [PIC]
[+2294] 'Daily Show' Destroys CNN For Fact-Checking 'SNL' Instead Of
item.description: Jon Stewart began his show last night by skewering CNN for fact checking an SNL skit. But letting politicians lie about statistics and never fact check them.

item.title: [+1459] I’m no zoologist, but I can tell you that’s not a deer [pic]
item.description: There’s a couple reasons this sign is confusing. First, I’m no zoologist, but I can tell you that’s not a deer. Actually, no, that’s the only reason…

item.title: [+1294] 9 Sexual Mistakes You Made in College
item.description: You may have thought you were in your sexual prime, but you were mainly just drunk and stupid.

item.title: [+1248] Clever New Fan Has No Blades
item.description: James Dyson, the British inventor behind the vacuums, has invented a fan that has no blades.

item.title: [+1217] Zombie Manger
item.description: When stores start selling Christmas stuff in October.

item.title: [+1159] Say Nuts! (Family Portrait)
[+1116] Noam Chomsky: "Taking Money Out of Politics is a Good Idea"
item.description: "Campaign funding is a remarkably good predictor of election and policy.. So yes, taking money out of politics would be a good idea... The supreme court is considering a suit, if they change the laws, it means that corporations can buy elections directly, instead of indirectly. They don't put it that way, but.. that's what it amounts to."

item.title: [+924] World's Largest Firework
item.description: This is a short video of what is supposedly the largest firework ever launched.

item.title: [+900] Spammer Challenge: Break This CAPTCHA
[+788] Schwarzenneger Signs New Anti-Paparazzi Law
item.description: HOLLYWOOD -- Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger has signed an anti-paparazzi law that makes it easier for celebrities to fight back against photographers who invade their privacy.

item.title: [+764] 6 gadgets Japan loves (and the U.S. rejected) | DVICE
item.description: Popular gadgets in Japan often just need a little time to start popping up in the U.S. For instance, most Japanese were using LCD monitors years before they were common stateside. But the rule doesn't hold for every gadget. Every now and then Japan produces a consumer technology that's incompatible with the American populace.

item.title: [+758] You Ladies Like Gameboy?
item.description: Maybe if you play your cards right, we can set up a game link and trade Pokemon.

item.title: [+611] The Mystery of Time, and Multiple Universes (made simple)
item.description: Caltech physicist Sean M. Carroll has been wrestling with the mystery of time. Most physical laws work equally well going backward or forward, yet time flows only in one direction. He suggests that entropy, the tendency of physical systems to become more disordered over time, plays a crucial role.

item.title: [+563] 25 Awesome Things Made Out of Beer Cans [PICS]
item.description: Have you ever wondered what happens to all those beer cans after you finish them off? Behold the awesomeness of 25 things fashioned from empty beer cans!

item.title: [+532] BREAKING - Key Senate Committee Passes Health Care Plan 14-9
item.description: The Senate Finance Committee passed a long-awaited $829 billion health care bill Tuesday by a 14-9 vote.

item.title: [+531] Ultra Slo-Mo Vid of Bullet Impacts--vs. Glass, Metal, Wood
item.description: Pretty strange, fascinating. Long video but can watch any or all of it. (Soundtrack rarely changes; so, if prefer, can mute for same -- or better -- effect.)

item.title: [+480] Next Firefox can detect computer orientation
item.description: The upcoming version 3.6 of Firefox will be able to tell if you're listing to starboard--and pass that information along to applications running in the browser.

item.title: [+480] New Macs on the Horizon?? [Rumors]
item.description: Product rumors have been fairly quiet on the Apple front recently, but the tech community has begun exchanging whispers about new Macs due in stores.

item.title: [+479] 25 Things I Learned About Business from "It's Always Sunny"
item.description: Fans of FX's It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia might chuckle at the idea of gleaning serious business advice from such a silly show.
